laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Retrospectively analyzed, the patient also displayed hyperthyrotropinemia at 6 years of age.

findings.TSH: Elevated TSH levels after L-T4 withdrawal
findings.free thyroxine: Decreased FT4 levels after L-T4 withdrawal

laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: When the patient was 10 years of age, L-T4 treatment was withdrawn for 1 month, and his thyroid function was re-evaluated.

findings.TSH response: Normal TSH and PRL responses to TRH
findings.FT4 increase: Below the normal range after TRH administration

laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: The FT4 increase was calculated as an indirect measure of TSH bioactivity, as reported during follow-up.

findings.hyperthyrotropinemia: Only one out of four siblings showed hyperthyrotropinemia in the first evaluation, two out of four six months later.

laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Indicating the intermittent nature of hyperthyrotropinemia in these individuals.

laboratory_examinations.procedure_name: Thyroid function profile of mother during pregnancy

findings.TSH: 3.72 mIU/L in the first trimester (Normal: <2.5 mIU/L)

laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: TSH elevation recurred in the third trimester; returned to normal after delivery.
